fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson's first speech as Prime Minister: factchecked
fact_check_explanation_summary: On 25 July Boris Johnson made his first speech as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom. We factchecked claims on no deal Brexit, the number of EU nationals living in …

fact_check_explanation_title: There’s no solid evidence to support this Brexit Party MEP’s claim about fishermen’s nets
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ann Widdecombe made a claim about fishing regulation during her maiden speech at the EU parliament saying they’d reduced income by 40%.

fact_check_explanation_title: These claims about radical Muslim preachers and Tommy Robinson are mostly incorrect
fact_check_explanation_summary: Anjem Choudary, Abu Qatada and Abu Hamza all received judicial action for their crimes.

fact_check_explanation_title: This Guardian quiz on Boris Johnson is meaningless
fact_check_explanation_summary: A recent Guardian quiz on Boris Johnson attracted over 70,000 responses. The respondents were not representative of Guardian readers or the public.

fact_check_explanation_title: Mobile phone base stations like this do not pose a radiation risk
fact_check_explanation_summary: The most powerful antennas have exclusion zones around them, but the mast in this viral post isn’t one of them.
The latest estimate for the size of the UK’s ‘divorce bill’ with the EU is £33 billion.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many people with dementia have to sell their homes to pay for care?
fact_check_explanation_summary: A poll found that 16% of respondents who said they had friends or family with dementia also said that person had to sell their home to pay for care.

fact_check_explanation_title: Was a record amount spent on private providers by the Department of Health?
fact_check_explanation_summary: £9.2 billion was spent on purchasing health care from private providers in 2018/19—a record amount in cash terms, but not in real terms or as a proportion of the department’s …

fact_check_explanation_title: It is generally fine to give your dog small amounts of ice
fact_check_explanation_summary: In most situations, it is fine to give your dogs ice or frozen treats.

fact_check_explanation_title: This advert on the tube was not made by the Conservatives
fact_check_explanation_summary: Political adverts aren’t allowed on the London Underground, and the advert is fake.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson’s kipper claim is a red herring
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson claimed that EU regulation required kipper sellers to pack kippers in ice. This is not an EU regulation – it is UK regulation.

fact_check_explanation_title: Old claim about Brexit economic boost resurfaces
fact_check_explanation_summary: A claim that a new analysis shows the UK will be £135 billion richer after Brexit is based on an old report from Economists for Free Trade. Most other economists …
